availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Berryman H. Flowers (Russell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Russell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Baker Flowers in Christian County, Kentucky, on March 24, 1825. Father of Rebecca Flowers, Luisa Flowers, Martha Flowers, Laura Flowers, and Milidon Flowers. Farmer in Russell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed Elijah Car as a farmer in Russell County in 1850. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Russell County in 1850. Farmer in Russell County in 1860. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in Russell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, District 1, p. 231A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, Russell, p. 780.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, Russell, p. 212A.
"Berryman H. Flowers (1800-Death 1871)," Find A Grave, Memorial 82835818, accessed June 19, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/82835818.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, Film 000465562, p. 73.
